title: Pluton is a Person, Not a Ship
theory: Similar to how Poseidon turned out to be a person (Princess Shirahoshi), Pluton is also a person rather than a physical weapon. Some theorists suggest that Momonosuke could be Pluton, capable of controlling not only Zunesha but also the borders of Wano and potentially other ancient mechanisms.
author: Various One Piece community members
notes: This theory recontextualizes the entire Pluton revelation from Episode 118, suggesting Crocodile was looking for a person rather than a weapon.

title: Pluton is a Giant Mechanized Whale
theory: Pluton is not a traditional battleship but a massive mechanized whale that could be used to destroy the Red Line in the final war. Chapter 1138 introduced a mural showing Joy Boy leading allies into battle, including a big whale carrying two people. This whale could be Pluton, designed to bring down the Red Line and create the All Blue.
author: Various One Piece theorists
notes: This theory connects to Episode 118's revelation of Pluton as a weapon capable of destroying islands, suggesting it's even more powerful than initially described.

title: Pluton's True Purpose: Land Remodeling, Not Destruction
theory: Pluton is not merely a weapon of war but a tool for large-scale land remodeling that doesn't just destroy islands but 'takes them away entirely.' Some theorists believe Wano was created using Pluton from six originally different islands, and its true purpose is to reshape the world's geography.
author: Various One Piece community members
notes: This theory suggests Crocodile's understanding of Pluton in Episode 118 was incomplete - it's not just a destructive weapon but a world-shaping tool.

title: The Nefertari Family's Secret Knowledge
theory: The Nefertari family's knowledge of Pluton, revealed in Episode 118, suggests they were one of the original 20 kingdoms that formed the World Government but chose not to become Celestial Dragons specifically to protect the secret of Pluton. Their role as guardians was more important than ruling the world.
author: One Piece community theorists
notes: This theory directly stems from Episode 118's revelation and has been partially confirmed by later story developments.

title: Crocodile's Plan Would Have Failed Anyway
theory: Even if Crocodile had successfully read the Poneglyph in Arabasta, he would have discovered that Pluton is actually in Wano Country, making his entire plan to conquer Arabasta ultimately futile. The Poneglyph doesn't contain Pluton itself but only directions to its location.
author: One Piece fans
notes: This theory is based on Episode 118's setup and was later confirmed in the Wano arc when Pluton's actual location was revealed.

title: Nico Robin Lied to Crocodile
theory: Some fans theorize that when Robin read the Poneglyph for Crocodile (in episodes following 118), she may have lied about what it said or omitted crucial information, protecting the secret of Pluton while appearing to cooperate with Crocodile.
author: One Piece community
notes: Episode 118 sets up Robin's role as the only person who can read the Poneglyph, making her trustworthiness crucial to Crocodile's plan.
